description.narrative: The overall desired impact of the proposed project is to reduce poverty in Egypt by increasing the effectiveness of Ministry of Social Solidarity service provision

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: - A comprehensive manual with Waai messages developed, printed and disseminated - 1000 women social workers (Raedat) trained on Waai messages - Trained Raedat on Waai program me integrated in Social Raedat Structures - MoSS policy group members selected. - Decree with policy resource group TORs issued. - Quarterly meetings held. - Annual work plans developed and approved. - Recommendations by Policy Group integrated in annual plans. - 3-4 local media campaign per governorate. (Minimum of 45 local campaigns in 3 years). - Posters and brochures for all Waai messages designed and approved by MoSS. - 15,000 posters and 30,000 brochures disseminated in 15 governorates to Takaful beneficiaries in different MoSS outlets. - 10-15 info-graphic short films produced and disseminated in T&K outlets using simple audio-visual screens or phone messages or other social media access tools. - Featured documentary films with success stories and models from each governorate documenting the transition and social change of targeted beneficiaries “Agents of Change in our village”. - Media platform established with media personnel highlighting MoSS policies inspired by lessons learned on the ground. - Number of viewers accessing campaigns. - Number of social national media agencies involved. - Duration of campaigns. - Impact evaluation (Number of comments & analysis of comments and issues raised). - 3 consultation meetings held with MoSS departments - Outreach operational framework finalized and launched. - Outreach operational framework disseminated to relevant partners and stakeholders - Number of materials produced and disseminated. - Number of campaigns produced and disseminated. - Number of outlets. - Viewership reports. - Number of beneficiaries at T&KP outlets. - Number of meeting reports developed - Technical committee decrees developed, approved and released. - Number of action plans developed. - Number of consultation meetings conducted with different departments.

comment.narrative: - Preliminary messages pre-tested on Takaful and Karama beneficiaries - Core group from Lower Egypt, Cairo and Minya governorates comprised of 600 Raedat are trained - Social Raedat structure and governorate map of social workers developed - Task force members comprised of MoSS staff department from different departments identified. - Available reports of pilot awareness activities implemented by MoSS. - Social Units at village level and Social Centres at district levels in 15 governorates. - Primary Health Care Units where health conditionality is applied to Takaful Beneficiary. - Primary schools where education conditionality is applied to Takaful Beneficiary. - Post Offices where women head to receive the monthly cash allocated for the families. - Literacy outlets of La Omeya Maa Takaful. - MoSS shelters for violated women. - Rehabilitation centres and offices for PwDs nationwide. - NGOs and CDAs working with MoSS. -MoSS Economic empowerment messages from Waai program. -MoSS media specialists -MoSS Economic Empowerment experts -MoSS existing social media platforms (website and Facebook page) -MoSS cadres working on exhibitions. -MoSS cadres working with productive families and handicrafts sector. -MoSS private partners in previous exhibitions (Alex Bank. Etc) . - Anti-Corruption report supported by UNDP. -MoSS existing structures and hierarchy. -MoSS Departments Terms of Reference. - MoSS existing structures and hierarchy. - MoSS Departments Terms of Reference. - Anti- corruption consultant report supported by UNDP. - Existing Surveys and Census. - Waai Pre-test reports on T&KP beneficiaries. - Reports of Social protection projects at MoSS.
- The project as signed in November due to delays in the needed clearances from the government hence the delay in the workplan for the year 2020
- The project as signed in November due to delays in the needed clearances from the government hence the delay in the workplan for the year 2020

- Information, education and communication (IE&C) material and training manuals on Waai developed - 4,000 Social Workers and Public Service workers are successfully trained on Step Down training - The Policy Resource Group (technical advocacy experts and development experts on Waai component) is in place - Media campaigns on “Waai” program curricula are implemented in targeted local communities - An anticorruption operational framework for MoSS that ensures better governance, hierarchy, reporting and accountability mechanisms and reduced corruption and manipulation routes for service provision departments, is in place

• Waai Comprehensive Manual covering 12 key Waai messages has developed, designed and printed to be used by social workers (Raedat), MoSS personnel, communication experts, NGO personnel etc. • Child marriage booklet had been developed, designed and disseminated in Waai campaigns in 4 governorates in Upper Egypt as part of a national campaign under the auspices of the Minister of Social Solidarity. • Waai youth awareness sessions were organized in Al Asmarat center to mobilize young, contribute to the advocacy of Waai issues and linking them to the services provided by MoSS. A total of Twelve awareness sessions were organized in seven nurseries reached 2,100 persons including nursery personnel and NGO personnel managing the nurseries • Manual for Training of Trainers (TOT) and stepdown training of Social Workers (Ra’edat) was developed including the pre- and post- assessment of trainers. • Operational Manual for the role of Social Workers (Ra’edat) including their selection criteria and monitoring and evaluation framework was developed to support recruiting more social workers and expanding their number from 2,500 to 20,000 persons • Two Field visits were implemented in Cairo (Al Asmarat) with selected journalists to raise awareness on Positive Parenting and FGM Abandonment which was followed by media coverage on media profile executed with national and private newspaper websites including – Youm 7 – Ahram – Masrawy – Al Watan News – Al Dostor – 8 TV and Radio Programs (DMC + CBC Extra News + Radio Networks) • A 16 Days of Activism social media campaign- co-funded by the Government of the United Kingdom and the European Union- reached around 8 million persons and the official page of the Ministry of Solidarity received more than 380,000 interactions, 8,500 comments, and more than 500,000 views of the campaigns videos. Additionally, on-the ground awareness activities by Ra’edat reached more than 100,000 beneficiaries. • The operational framework for Waai interventions had been completed by Waai experts focusing on the 52 districts targeted by the Presidential Initiative Hayah Karema (Decent life). The Framework includes direct MoSS interventions, and partners activities by contracted or selected NGOs as well as partnerships with relevant national stakeholders such as the Ministries of Culture, Youth and Sports, and Information etc. • Around 4,000 Face Masks were delivered to North-Sinai as emergency intervention, in cooperation with Red Crescent Association, with hygiene practices messages and other Waai messages related to civil rights, education and girls rights (early marriage and FGM abandonment). The Face Masks were distributed via 2 Medical Convoys held and 2,000 masks were distributed per convoy. • A new organogram have been developed, reviewed and approved by the central agency for organization and administration (CAOA) to accommodate the required restructuring of MoSS Departments, strengthen the quality of services delivered to the public and enhance expansion of programs related to economic empowerment of vulnerable groups, social protection, social care, and effective engagement of civil society in social development schemes. • A study including an anticorruption operational framework was delivered with recommendations on improving and strengthening monitoring and accountability mechanisms at MoSS (cash transfer and social care programs). • Completed 105 trainings for 3,000 participants in leadership, Customer service and complaints management, projects management, design thinking, digital transformation, code of conduct and Governance. There is an ongoing collaboration with the central department for information systems and digital transformation to work on a platform for the ministry to disseminate digital training programs and to work on the e-archiving process of the training programs.

- Develop an anticorruption operational framework for MoSS that ensures better governance, hierarchy, reporting and accountability mechanisms and reduced corruption and manipulation routes for service provision departments - Conduct impact evaluation review on social protection issues covered by MOSS Waai program to measure social and behaviour change among marginalized groups targeted by MOSS through the national center for social and criminology studies - Develop and disseminate key messages among the youths to safeguard and protect the elderly in their families and communities from contracting Covid-19 through social-media and media campaigns (TV and radio) - Utilize existing Waai’s Good Hygiene Practices pillar to combat the spread of Covid-19, and promoting social distancing as a protective measure, and correcting wrongful Covid-19 related misinformation and rumors, as well as Waai’s Economic Empowerment pillar for those financially impacted by Covid-19 through social-media and media campaigns (TV and radio) - Finalize and launch community outreach national operational framework for enhancing community mobilization and awareness systems targeting MoSS beneficiaries
